subject: Re: [junit] Slightly modified behaviour of Parameterized Runner
msgSnippet: To emphasize my concern, in the past, the Parameters runner would allow a lazy evaluation of parameters.  As long as you knew the number of rows in the table
messageBody:
To emphasize my concern, in the past, the Parameters runner would
allow a "lazy" evaluation of parameters. As long as you knew the
number of rows in the table of parameter values, you could avoid
computing/loading the actual values until they were needed to run. I
imagined this being useful if, for example, the parameter data was
loaded from lines in a file.

However, I'm not aware of anyone who's actually used this facility. Is there?

David Saff

On Mon, Oct 24, 2011 at 5:12 AM, Stefan Birkner <mail@...> wrote:
> I just created a bugfix for the Parameterized runner. The pull request slightly modifies the behaviour of the runner. Today the @Parameter method is called when TestClassRunnerForParameters.createTest() is called(). After my change the method is called when the Parameterized runner is created.
>
> Does anybody know a reason, why we shouldn't do this modification.
>
> stefan
>
>
>
